message.content: This question requires a basic understanding of temperature and the properties of hot liquids. A hot liquid is one that has a high temperature. Option (C), pasta water bubbling on the stove, indicates that the water is being heated and is therefore likely hot. Option (A), an old cup of coffee, does not specify the temperature and could be cold. Option (B), a tall glass of milk, does not specify the temperature and could be cold or at room temperature. Option (D), a warm cup of cocoa, suggests that the cocoa is not hot but warm, so it is not the best choice for a hot liquid.

This question requires knowledge of the temperature of liquids. A hot liquid is one that has a high temperature. Option (C) is the correct answer because boiling water on a stove would be considered a hot liquid. Option (A) is incorrect because an old cup of coffee would have cooled down and no longer be hot. Option (B) is incorrect because a tall glass of milk could be cold or at room temperature, not necessarily hot. Option (D) is incorrect because a warm cup of cocoa implies that it is not hot, but rather warm.
